item
Interface ILightGrenade

All Superinterfaces:
IItem
All Known Implementing Classes:
LightGrenade
public interface ILightGrenade
extends IItem

A light grenade always is in a LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState. Initially in the INACTIVE state. Only inactive grenades can be carried. A player may only 'trigger' a light grenade, which means the grenade will become 'active', once the player leaves the square. When a player enters a square with an active light grenade, it will go in the 'exploded' state.

Method Summary
 void enable()
          This method sets the state of the grenade to LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState .ACTIVE.
 void explode()
          This method sets the state of the grenade to LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState .EXPLODED
 LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState getState()
          This method returns the current LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState the grenade is in.
 
Methods inherited from interface item.IItem
addToEffect, getId, isCarriable, use
 

Method Detail

getState

LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState getState()
This method returns the current LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState the grenade is in.

Returns:
the current LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState the grenade is in.

enable

void enable()
            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method sets the state of the grenade to LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState .ACTIVE. It cannot be called until the player who dropped the lightgrenade and triggered it, left the square.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - The transition to the ACTIVE state must be valid from the current state: this.getState().isAllowedTransistionTo(LightGrenadeState.ACTIVE)

explode

void explode()
             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
This method sets the state of the grenade to LightGrenade.LightGrenadeState .EXPLODED

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - The transition to the EXPLODED state must be valid from the current state: this.getState().isAllowedTransistionTo(LightGrenadeState.EXPLODED)
